job_purpose: To build and maintain analytics services on a Microsoft Azure-hosted Digital Data Platform, create secure and scalable data pipelines, engage with stakeholders to deliver solutions, transform raw data into valuable insights, work in an agile environment, and support governance frameworks around data ownership and cataloguing.
job_duties_and_responsibilities: Building and maintaining analytics services on a Microsoft Azure-hosted Digital Data Platform
Creating secure, scalable data pipelines using Azure Data Factory, Databricks, and related tools
Engaging with stakeholders across the business to understand their data needs and deliver solutions
Helping transform raw data into valuable insights by modeling it into robust, dimensional formats
Working in an agile environment, deploying resources via CI/CD and managing code through Azure DevOps
Supporting and maintaining governance frameworks around data ownership and cataloguing
required_qualifications: At least 3 years of experience in data engineering, integration, or application development
Hands-on experience with Azure Data Factory (or Fabric Pipelines), plus broader Azure cloud skills
A solid grasp of data warehousing, ETL concepts, and modern data platform architectures
Experience using CI/CD tools (Terraform, Jenkins, etc.) and Git-based version control
A collaborative, stakeholder-focused mindset – with the ability to work autonomously as needed
preferred_qualifications: Prior experience in mining or refinery operations (highly desirable)
A degree in Computer Science, IT, Engineering, or similar – or equivalent hands-on experience
company_name: Confidential (Company Name not provided in the job description)
company_details: A well-established and forward-thinking organization seeking a skilled Data Engineer to help drive their digital transformation journey. The role involves working on a modern Azure-hosted platform, collaborating with various teams, and contributing to solving real operational problems.
